gurmukhi: so n brY Aiq ros BrI qb ] nwk ktwie geI giH ko sB ]336]
transliteration: So Na Darai At(i) Ros Bharitab|| Naak Kataae Gadgrih Ko Sabh||336||
translation: When he also refused to wed her, then she was filled with great rage and went to her home after getting her nose chopped.336.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky rwm Avqwr kQw sUpnKw ko nwk kwtbo DXwie smwpqm squ suBm squ ]5]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatake Raam Avtaar Kathaa|| Soopnakhaa Ko Naak Kaadho Dhyaae Samaaptam Sat(u) Soubham Sat(u)||
translation: End of the Chapter regarding the Chopping of the Nose of Surapanakha in the story of Rama Incarnation in BACHITTAR NATAK.
The beginning of the description of the battle with the demons Khar and Dusman :

gurmukhi: rwvn qIr ruroq BeI jb ] ros Bry dnu bMs blI sB ]
transliteration: Raavan Teer Rurot Bhaijab|| Ros Bhare Dan(u) Bans Balisabh||
translation: When Surapanakha went weeping near Ravana, then the whole demon-clan was filled with fury.

gurmukhi: lMks DIr bjIr bulwey ] dUKn AO Kr deIq pTwey ]337]
transliteration: Lankas Dheer Bajeer Bulaae|| Dookhan Au Khar Daeet Pathaae||337||
translation: The king of Lanka called his ministers for consultations and sent two demons Khar and Dushan for killing ram etc. 337.

gurmukhi: swj snwh subwh durM gq ] bwjq bwj cly gj g`jq ]
transliteration: Saaj Sanaah Soubaah Duran Gad|| Baajat Baaj Chale Gad Gadjat||
translation: Wearing their armours all the long-armed warriors marched forward with the resounding of musical instruments and the roaring of elephants.

gurmukhi: mwr hI mwr dso ids kUky ] swvn kI Gt jXoN Gur FUky ]338]
transliteration: Maar Himaar Daso Dis Kooke|| Saavan Kighat Jyon Ghur Dhooke||338||
translation: There was noise of “kill, kill” from all the four sides and the army gushed forward like the clouds of the month of sawan.338.

gurmukhi: g`jq hY rxbIr mhwN mn ] q`jq hYN nhI BUim AXoDn ]
transliteration: Gadjat Hai Ranbeermahaan Man|| Tajjat Hain Nahibhoom(i) Ayodhan||
translation: The mighty warriors thundered and stood firmly on the ground.

gurmukhi: Cwjq hY cK sRoxq so sr ] nwid krYN iklkwr BXMkr ]339]
transliteration: Chhaadat Hai Chakh Sronat So Sar|| Naadh Karian Kilkaar Bhayankar||339||
translation: The pools of blood flourished and the warriors raised terrible shrieks.339.

gurmukhi: rn rwj kumwr ibr`cihgy ] sr syl srwsn n`cihgy ]
transliteration: Ran Raaj Koumaar Birachchaih-ge|| Sar Sel Saraasan Nachchaihge||
translation: When the princes will begin the battle, there will be the dance of lances and shafts.

gurmukhi: su ibru`D Av`iD su gwjihgy ] rx rMgih rwm ibrwjihgy ]340]
transliteration: Su Biruddh Avaddh(i) Su Gadjaih-ge|| Ran Ranad(i) Raam Biraajaih-ge||340||
translation: The warriors will roar on seeing the opposing forces and Ram will be absorbed in the fighting mood.340.
